entry.title: Add logging of clicking on external links from the security settings page in the HaTS data
entry.content: As of 123.0.6312.5, the security page HaTS does not log clicking on external links as a user action. Let's add this as a new [SecurityPageInteraction](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/hats_handler.h;l=84-91;drc=b8100f95c742b7c7dd1e1a259eeaeffa3a7200c2).

entry.title: Prevent security page HaTS from launching on subpage navigations
entry.content:
As of 123.0.6312.5, the security page HaTS launches on subpage navigations. Let's add an improvement to prevent launching the survey in these cases, because the user may not be done with the security settings page yet.
New cases where the survey won't be launched: * manage security keys sub-page * manage certificates sub-page

entry.title: Decrease granularity of time on security page logging for security page HaTS
entry.content:
The security page HaTS currently logs the time spent on page in milliseconds. It'd be useful to log this in seconds instead of in milliseconds to simplify the steps needed for analysis.
We can do the conversion/truncation around the time when the security_page asks for the survey to be shown: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/settings/privacy_page/security_page.ts;l=388;drc=440d6514def8b060f9ebae6408e1faa0ee3f828e

entry.title: I want to delete
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem? being deleted
What is the expected result? to be deleted from my laptop
What happens instead?
it wont delete You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Implement logging of "always use secure connections" button in Security page HaTS
entry.content:
Let's add a new SecurityPageInteraction for clicks on "always use secure connections" to the security page HaTS and start logging those interactions.
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/hats_handler.h;l=84-91;drc=b8100f95c742b7c7dd1e1a259eeaeffa3a7200c2

entry.title: Improve the granularity of SecurityPageInteraction
entry.content:
The implementation of SecurityPageInteraction as of 123.0.6312.5 only contains whether a click occurred.
We'd like for the security page interactions to include more information. For example, instead of `EXPAND_BUTTON_ENHANCED_CLICK`, we'd want `EXPAND_BUTTON_ENHANCED_EXPANDED`, `EXPAND_BUTTON_ENHANCED_COLLAPSED`. Otherwise we can't tell if users are expanding the enhanced box to read more details, or closing it.
Similar for the other cases on the page.
Definition of the enum is in `hats_handler.h` and must be kept in sync with `hats_browser_proxy.ts`
* [hats_hander.h](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/hats_handler.h;l=84;drc=b8100f95c742b7c7dd1e1a259eeaeffa3a7200c2) * [hats_browser_proxy.ts](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/settings/hats_browser_proxy.ts;l=33-40;drc=ee1264ea003c2a0f14cc68e585706a13901ad7a4)

entry.title: Application panel show duplicated cookies when one is blocked and one is allowed
entry.content:
Chrome version: 123.0.6312.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64)
1. Go to https://wobbly-violet-heaven.glitch.me/, open DevTools. 2. Click the “Set cookie (SameSite=None)” button in the first iframe, a request is sent with 3pc blocked. 3. Go to Application panel, check cookies for domain https://cr2.kungfoo.net 4. The table shows that the “unpartitioned” cookie is blocked. 5. Click the “Request storage access” button in the first iframe, grant permission. 6. Click “Set cookie (SameSite=None)” button again 7. In the Application panel, the cookie table shows two “unpartitioned” cookies with one blocked and one not blocked.

entry.title: CTS Tests Fail due to "bind failed: EACCES"
entry.content:
Many CTS Tests fail when changing to runtime-based test discovery ([this cl](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5293118)). These tests were not previously being run according to test history, so filing this bug to track their disabled state.
The errors all appear to look like:
``` java.net.BindException: bind failed: EACCES (Permission denied) at libcore.io.IoBridge.bind(IoBridge.java:150) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(PlainSocketImpl.java:162) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.bind(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:427) at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(ServerSocket.java:377) at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:237) at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:128) at android.webkit.cts.CtsTestServer$ServerThread.<init>(CtsTestServer.java:1023) at android.webkit.cts.CtsTestServer.<init>(CtsTestServer.java:244) at android.webkit.cts.CtsTestServer.<init>(CtsTestServer.java:221) at android.webkit.cts.CtsTestServer.<init>(CtsTestServer.java:196) at android.webkit.cts.CtsTestServer.<init>(CtsTestServer.java:186) at android.webkit.cts.CtsTestServer.<init>(CtsTestServer.java:165) at android.webkit.cts.WebChromeClientTest.setUp(WebChromeClientTest.java:70) ... 25 trimmed Caused by: android.system.ErrnoException: bind failed: EACCES (Permission denied) at libcore.io.Linux.bind(Native Method) at libcore.io.ForwardingOs.bind(ForwardingOs.java:141) at libcore.io.ForwardingOs.bind(ForwardingOs.java:141) at libcore.io.IoBridge.bind(IoBridge.java:146) ```

entry.title: Log the last n user actions before launching the Security Settings HaTS
entry.content:
The product string data on the security settings HaTS currently logs only the last action. It would help the survey reviewers to see more of the actions before the survey was launched.
To do this, we need to pass in a list of actions to `GetSecurityPageProductSpecificStringData`. The current implementation on the security_page.ts just has a single value, for the last interaction -- we'd update this to be a list of actions.
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/settings/hats_handler.cc;l=151;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/settings/privacy_page/security_page.ts;l=247;drc=440d6514def8b060f9ebae6408e1faa0ee3f828e

entry.title: Default (profile picker) shortcut incorrectly associated with badged default profile at runtime
entry.content:
Platform: Win10\ Version: All (up to >= 123.0.6312.1; repros on current M121 Stable too)
Noticed this while setting up a new machine, a normal user would have no way to understand this distinction.
Repro:\ A) Launch Chrome with a brand new User Data (new machine or use --user-data-dir)\ B) Sign-in to the default profile (expected: no badge, WAI)\ C) Create a second profile and sign-in to that with a separate account
Expected: Both profile are now badged and the default profile's runtime icon is no longer associated with the default shortcut (which is now intended to launch and associate with the profile picker).
Actual: 1) When Chrome isn't running (1):\ The default shortcut is unbadged 2) When the profile picker is up (2), launched via the default shortcut:\ The profile picker window associates to a separate unbadged runtime icon. 3) When the default profile is running: \ The badged icon for the default profile is not associated with the default shortcut (allowing the user to pin the profile specific shortcut if they want to ).
As-is there's no way to pin the profile specific shortcut for the default profile (unpin/repin yields the same result).
PS: I don't think this happens if at step (B) in the repro one opts for a "New Profile" instead of "Link my Data" (as there will no longer be a default profile), but this only makes the point that the distinction is so subtle that it shouldn't exist.
davidbienvenu@ did some work in this area (Windows integration of shortcut badges) before Profile Picker/sign-in improvements, there was a debate then about the best behavior for the default shortcut but I think it's moot now that unbadged shortcut should == profile picker under multi-profile (letting the user repin the profile specific one if they prefer that).
The association in the taskbar is made by matching on shortcut properties (`base::win::ShortcutProperties::set_app_id`) vs browser windows (`ui::win::SetAppIdForWindow`). Typically obtained from `GetAppUserModelIdForBrowser` or `GetAppUserModelIdForApp`.

entry.title: backtraces are not happening on Linux for some stacks (specifically from libc++ templates)
entry.content:
builtin_trap should generate a signal which goes to our usual signal handling, but it seems our stack unwinding is somehow broken with __builtin_trap?
This was reported on Chromium-dev:
> I just spent some time figuring out why a test is crashing without any error message or stacktrace on my machine or in the CQ and it looks like accessing an empty std::optional is not producing any useful output on Linux. > > Here is a CL to show a few examples: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5310276?attempt=1&checksRunsSelected=linux-rel&tab=checks The OptionalDeref test just shows up as crashed without any more information. > > std::variant seems to have the same issue, where it crashes on wrong usage without output. absl::variant works well. On Windows and iOS, all of these tests produce useful output.

entry.title: EGTest: Snackbar should be removed as they don’t disappear by themselves
entry.content: Snackbar that comes with an action, such as all snackbars related to bookmark, do not disappear anymore. This is an accessibility change. This cause tests that check for the snackbar to disappear to fail when run locally. Somehow, they succeed on the bots so it was not detected. But it stop us from update those tests.

entry.title: Handle multiple scrolls started at same time in case of OOPIFs
entry.content:
In this change: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5181359/10, we wanted to make an assumption that we always have a single active scroll within a window. But we do have some scenarios in which we see two scrolls going on simultaneously - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/527VSC57u5KArad.
This is a [trace](https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=d1b1203f7376cdcaa7c5bfd47d2f47b730726c630a248b2af721b9c75a933ec5) from a [browser test](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/site_per_process_layout_browsertest.cc;drc=247f72f44cbb584bd4b79fd6ca50692bc9d0f0c6;l=2325) which triggers this behavior. In the test we have two pointers down and then we move both of them simultaneously, movement in one of the pointers cause scroll to start in the child frame[1]. Movement in both also starts a pinch gesture, but the child can't handle the pinch so it goes to the root view which starts a scroll before starting a pinch begin on root frame, this causes two scrolls to exist: - Scroll in child iframe since this is where the pointers were moving. - Scroll in root frame since pinch is being handled in root frame which requires a scroll begin as well.
Trace slice id(20243) where pinch begin results in a scroll begin and a pinch begin being forwarded.
Ideally we would want to end the scroll in child so that we can have that invariant of always one active scroll true.
[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_input_event_router.cc;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090;l=1506

entry.title: Remove pre-ChromeRefresh2023 code paths
entry.content: Tracking bug for work related to removal of old, pre-ChromeRefresh2023/GM3 code paths.

entry.title: Update the Shared Storage Perf tests to include a DocumentGet perf story
entry.content: In https://crrev.com/c/5279221, we're adding the ability to call `sharedStorage.get()` in a fenced frame document where network access has been properly restricted. This involves adding a new `DocumentGet` event to DevTools, and performance tests should reflect this new event type.

entry.title: document.getSelection() returns unselected text when using NG-ZORRO badge
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Use a NG-ZORRO badge between some text 2. Add 'user-select: none' on the badge to make it not selectable in CSS 3. Select the text with and log document.getSelection().toString()
# Problem Description document.getSelection().toString() adds '123456789' string in a selected text when a NG-ZORRO badge is selected even if it is supposed to be not selectable with 'user-select: none' applied in CSS.
Example on StackBlitz https://angular-jxpst5.stackblitz.io/
Working well on Firefox.
# Summary document.getSelection() returns unselected text when using NG-ZORRO badge
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>TEXTSELECTion
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue Also not working in Edge, but working in Firefox.
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

Also: join manual AccountInfo capabilities and system capabilities fetching into a single method and out of the mediator constructor.

entry.title: variations_seed_simulator_unittest should cover studies constrained to DEFAULT and LOW layers
entry.content:
crbug.com/41491646 adds test cases to variations_seed_simulator_unittest for studies constrained to layers with EntropyMode.LIMITED .
The unit test should have coverage for studies constrained to layers with EntropyMode.DEFAULT and EntropyMode.LOW too. This is P3 since it doesn't increase the coverage within the variations seed simulator, because it would test functions that the simulator calls into, and those functions are already tested through other entry points. It's still nice to have so that the behavior of the simulator is protected against accidental changes.

entry.title: Last row is not entirely visible

It seems that the height of the scrollable container is calculated only with normal rows -> see column "Waterfall" which is ok.

entry.title: Disable the initiator link when the entry linked is outside of the current breadcrumb
Using scroll-snap-type: x mandatory; in chrome mobile devtools can break mouse scroll
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open chrome (occurs in version 121) devtools with mobile emulation 2. swipe carousel with scroll-snap-type: x mandatory; 3. during animation of carousel point mouse below carousel and immediately try to scroll down with mouse scroll wheel # Problem Description I have markup ```html
el 0
el 1
el 2
el 3




``` ```css .carousel { scroll-snap-type: x mandatory; overflow: auto; display: flex; } .carousel > * { scroll-snap-align: start; flex-shrink: 0; width: 300px; height: 200px; background-color: aquamarine; } ``` Codepen: https://codepen.io/michaljanaszek/pen/BabeaKW When I inspect this code in chrome devtools with mobile I can break ability to scroll page. Steps to reproduce: 1. open chrome (occurs in version 121) devtools with mobile emulation 2. swipe carousel with scroll-snap-type: x mandatory; 3. during animation of carousel point mouse below carousel and immediately try to scroll down with mouse scroll wheel Efect: mouse scroll stops working, I'm able only to scroll vertically page by dragging page (like on mobile). This error stays in browser even when I refresh page (not visible in codepen, only when you recreate this code for example in single index.html). To go away I have to close tab and open new. Is this problem only in devtools? Can it influence real users? The same question in StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/78034491/using-scroll-snap-type-x-mandatory-in-chrome-can-breaks-scroll # Summary Using scroll-snap-type: x mandatory; in chrome mobile devtools can break mouse scroll # Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: EG test app interface access should be restricted with DEPS
entry.content:
Let’s work with an example. The file ios/chrome/test/earl_grey/chrome_earl_grey_app_interface.h should generally not be used, except by ios/chrome/test/earl_grey/chrome_earl_grey.h. Both files contains very similar method, but `chrome_earl_grey.h` sometime contains extra steps that should be executed on the earl grey process.
Sometime, developers uses the app_interface one directly. Sometime it’s not even clear, if you don’t know the internals of eg-test, why there seems to be two similar classes and function.
Using DEPS, we can ensure that any developer that tries to use the app interface directly could not get their CL merged unless an owner of the app interface accept their CL. Generally, this owner could tell the dev to use the correct header instead. Better, correct documentation in DEPS could directly tell the dev which file to import.
This can be done simply by adding `"-ios/chrome/test/earl_grey/chrome_earl_grey_app_interface.h",` to each dependency that adds a folder containing (indirectly) this file.
The same thing can be done for other pairs of classes, such as SigninEarlGrey and SigninEarlGreyAppInterface.

entry.title: Low audio in Enforce ROM
entry.content:
Summary of the problem:
While working on a new Android device running base Android 12, I noticed a significant difference in sound volume behaviour between SELinux permissive and SELinux enforced (user-debug build) modes. In SELinux permissive mode, the volume ranges from 0.0000 to 1.0000, but in SELinux enforced mode, it only ranges from 0.0000 to 0.1000. This discrepancy was observed via logs obtained from `audio_hw_primary` and `out_set_compr_volume`.
Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Enable SELinux permissive mode and flash build on the Android device. 2. Observe the sound volume behavior and range (0.0000 to 1.0000). 3. Enable SELinux enforced mode and flash buil(userdebug) on the same device. 4. Observe the sound volume behavior and range (0.0000 to 0.1000).
Expected result: The sound volume range should remain consistent regardless of SELinux mode, ranging from 0.0000 to 1.0000.
Actual result: In SELinux permissive mode, the volume range is 0.0000 to 1.0000, but in SELinux enforced mode (userdebug), it is restricted to 0.0000 to 0.1000.

entry.title: Insecure OS/Firmware (Task Hijacking)/ Lack of Protection against Task Hijacking in org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.MediaLauncherActivity
entry.content:
Insecure OS/Firmware (Task Hijacking)/ Lack of Protection against Task Hijacking in org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.MediaLauncherActivity
Affected Product: com.brave.browser 1.60.118 (426011822)
VRT Category: Insecure Data Storage
Priority: P2
Variant / Affected Function: Component is the MediaLauncherActivity within the org.chromium.chrome.browser.media package. This activity is vulnerable to task hijacking due to the misconfiguration of the taskAffinity and launchMode attributes.
CVSS Score: 6.8 (Medium)
Vector: CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N
CWE-119: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer. This vulnerability involves improper handling or configuration of attributes (taskAffinity and launchMode) in the Android manifest file, leading to the potential vulnerability of task hijacking.
Summary ---------------- The activity org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.MediaLauncherActivity is vulnerable to task hijacking as it lacks the proper configuration of the taskAffinity attribute, and the launchMode attribute is set to "None". Task hijacking occurs when an activity is not properly protected against being launched in the context of another task, potentially leading to unauthorized access and exposure of sensitive information.
Proof of Concept ----------------------------
Affected Code ----------------------- <activity xmlns:ns0="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android" ns0:theme="@7F1503B3" ns0:name="org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.MediaLauncherActivity" ns0:enabled="false" ns0:exported="true" ns0:excludeFromRecents="true"> <intent-filter> <action ns0:name="android.intent.action.VIEW"/> <category ns0:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT"/> <data ns0:mimeType="image/*"/> <data ns0:mimeType="video/*"/> <data ns0:scheme="file"/> <data ns0:scheme="content"/> </intent-filter> </activity>
Suggested Code Fix -------------------------------- <activity ... android:taskAffinity="" android:launchMode="singleTask" android:exported="false"> ... </activity>
Exploit ----------- An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by launching the MediaLauncherActivity in the context of a malicious task using the Android Debug Bridge (ADB) command:
adb shell am start -n org.chromium.chrome.browser.media/.MediaLauncherActivity --activity-clear-task
By doing so, the attacker gains unauthorized access to the application's functionality and potentially sensitive user data within the context of the malicious task.
Impact ------------ Lack of protection against task hijacking may allow an attacker to launch the MediaLauncherActivity in the context of another task, leading to unauthorized access and potential exposure of sensitive information.
Mitigations ------------------ Assign a specific taskAffinity value to the MediaLauncherActivity to ensure it is associated only with tasks launched from the same application. Assess the necessity of setting launchMode to specific values based on the application's requirements. Review the necessity of setting android:exported="true" for MediaLauncherActivity. If external access is not required, set it to false.
References ------------------ OWASP - A3:2017-Sensitive Data Exposure OWASP - A5:2017-Broken Access Control (BAC) OWASP - A6:2017-Security Misconfiguration
Earlier i reported this to Brave Software, their response was as follows:- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- artem_chaikin Brave Software staff 9 minutes ago
This Activity is a part of Chromium's manifest https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/AndroidManifest.xml;l=355. Can you report this to them?

entry.title: UserInteractionsHandler unit tests failing
entry.content: The 'detects correct events for a click and keydown interaction' and the 'finds all interaction events with a duration and interactionId' tests are failing after https://crrev.com/c/5309877, because they never actually run before (`it` nested within `it` doesn't work).

entry.title: help with two step verification
entry.content: I have been attempting to access my personal gmail account, I have used my correct password, I have used my phone number and other gmail account for verification, but the system doesn't allow me to use verifications under my account. I need to access my gmail account (lucylibosha@gmail.com). My email is connected to much of how I organize my life, bills, calendars, taxes, correspondence, etc. This has been an issue for over a week, I've tried to log in several times (phone and computer) to no avail. I have called the google phone number, but there was no answer (phantom number). How can I get help to access my account?? If there is suspicious activity, why can't I use two-step to verify and why can't the suspicious behavior be resolved?

Hello World

This is a paragraph with a link in it.

This is a paragraph without a link at all

\" The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ReadAnythingAppE2ETest.Sample These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/c3a6ba12d7ba6026a55165d4efa050cf How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? entry.title: Chrome chrashes on page load with error STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem The problem in hard to reproduce. Sometimes it works, sometimes the browser crashes.
# Problem Description Sometimes, when the page loads, it start to rende, but after a short moment, it crashes.
# Summary Chrome chrashes on page load with error STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION
# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? Just one tab
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself

entry.title: Frame icon in network panel is displayed incorrectly
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to - https://example.org/ 2. Open devtools 3. Go to console and create iframe, for example: const frame = document.createElement('iframe'); frame.src = '/'; document.body.appendChild(frame); 4. Go to network panel and enable "Group by frame" option 5. Look at the iframe icon
# Problem Description The iframe icon is not centered and bottom of it is not visible. Please take a look on attached screenshots, one from Chrome 121 (displayed correctly) and another from 122.
# Additional Comments The same issue occurs in Chrome dev 123.0.6300.3
# Summary Frame icon in network panel is displayed incorrectly
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: chrome.windows.onFocusChanged is not fired correctly on Windows.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Add chrome.windows.onFocusChanged listener with a log to the Chrome extension. 2. Enable the extension and change the window from Chrome to any other app. Note: onFocusChanged was not called. 3. Come back to Chrome, onFocusChanged will be called with the current windowId. 4. Switch to any other tab in the same Chrome window: onFocusChanged callback is called, where the current window is chrome.windows.WINDOW_ID_NONE.
# Problem Description There's an issue with chrome.windows.onFocusChanged on Windows. It was reproduced on the next app version: 5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36.
# Summary chrome.windows.onFocusChanged is not fired correctly on Windows.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Potential crashes when sign-in coordinator is already shown
entry.content:
We have now stable data related to the fact that a sign-in promo is already shown when a new promo is supposed to be shown - see histograms Signin.ShowSigninCoordinatorWhenAlreadyPresent.NewAccessPoint and Signin.ShowSigninCoordinatorWhenAlreadyPresent.OldAccessPoint (and attached screenshots)
From this data a lot of crashes are related to post restore sign-in promo that is shown when the upgrade sign-in promo is presented.

entry.title: Step "cast_unittests on Ubuntu-22.04" failing on builder "chromium/ci/android-12-x64-rel" failed because of failed emulator start
entry.content: The step `cast_unittests on Ubuntu-22.04` seems to have failed because there was a time out creating the emulator image: https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=67e42a479228e210
